args: Happy New Year, one and all!
Happy New Year. I'm glad we made it\nthrough another one safe and sound.
Wooo! Okay, so what's the first thing we do\nto ring in the new year Hinomoto-style?
Er, why are you asking me?
Because you were standing there?\nRelax, it ain't a trick question.
Traditionally, we would start with the first\nshrine visit of the new year.
On the first day of the new year, we go\nto a shrine to offer our prayers.
We give thanks for living through the last\nyear and to ask for happiness in the next.
And you do this at a shrine, yeah?\nWhat's that all about?
Well, many of our shrines are dedicated to\nthe goddess Amaterasu. There are even\nstatues of her contained within.
I understand those of the Ilian Church pray\nto a statue of their goddess, while sylvans\npray to the forest itself.
Similarly, we offer prayers at shrines—\nin this case, for a safe and happy year.
The first visit thing! Let's go.
I'm not aware of any Hinomotoan shrines\nexisting in Alberia.
Well yeah, but the point is to thank and\npray to the thing watchin' over us, right?
Cause we've DEFINITELY got one of those!
Ohhh. Yes, that's quite the sight.
If there's one thing we can be thankful for\nsaving our butts on the daily, it's dragons!
So how do we do this thing, huh?\nGo prostrate? Pound the chest?\nIs there wailing involved? I love wailing!
The first shrine visit thing! Focus, man!\nThere's gotta be a protocol, yeah?
Oh, er, yes. Of course. Well, to start with,\nwe bow once before the torii.
Put simply, it's the gate to the shrine.\nSo in this case, I suppose it would be\nthe garden entrance?
We wash our hands and mouth\nat the water station.
Huh? But I'm already all clean and shiny.
Perhaps that's the case physically, but...\nLook, that's just how it works.
Because I said so. Now, here's how you\nwash: Take the dipper in your right hand,\nscoop the water, and then proceed.
Okay, I see. So it's sorta like a\ncleansing of the body, yeah?
Just so. Though as we have no water\nstation here, we can skip that step and—
I'm gonna go clean up, and I mean the\nworks—EEEVERY last nook and cranny!
What?! Oh dear. I don't understand ANY\nof this, and all the chaos is starting to\nmake my stomach hurt...
Okay! Back and freshly bathed!\nSeriously, I'm sparkling. *gleam*
That is...fine, I suppose? Now we ring the\nshrine bell and pray—though we probably\ndon't have such a thing around here.
Howzabout the one around Mariti's neck?\nI bet it rings like a champ.
The children of the choir gave me this.\nIt's my most precious treasure.
Aww, c'mon, lemme ring it! I promise to\npray some extra gratitude your waaay...
Oh, very well. If you must.\nBut only this once!
Right, that takes care of the bell. Oh,\nbut before you ring it, you have to place\nan offering in the coin box.
But as we have no coin box, we can sk—
NO SKIPPING! C'mon, I wanna do this\nright—or as close as possible, anyway.
May I ask why the most laid-back person\nin the entire Halidom is suddenly such a\nstickler for exacting protocol?
Because it's my friends' culture and I\ndon't want to do a half-butt job of it!\nIt's a respect thing, yeah?
I ain't gonna disrespect Hinomoto OR you!
I see now that it is more than good cheer\nwhich brings people to your side.
You're happy-go-lucky, but still sincere.\nIt's the combination of the two that earns\nyou their trust—and mine.
Easy, now! You're gonna give me an ego.\nSeriously though, thanks for that.\nAnyway, what's next? And don't ski—
Worry not; I'll be sure to give you\nthe full and unabridged version.
You had quite the intense look while you\nheld your hands together. Might I ask\nwhat you were praying for?
I asked for a ton of new friends.
Heh. I doubt you need to worry about that.
(He has no self-awareness about his\ncheerfulness OR sincerity. He's just...\nhimself. Totally, wonderfully artless.)
(His true heart will resonate with others',\nand they will willingly open up to him.\nI now see that first-hand.)
I hope this year will be a good one, Luca.
You say that like it's up to chance!\nWe're gonna make it great together!
Ha ha, right you are, my friend. I have\nfull faith we'll see that prediction fulfilled.
